page.title: 02LOCAL TOPOGRAPHY
page.content: This is a farming area. Mainly arable. The crops grown are wheat,barley,oats, pulses,sugar beet and oil seed rape. Meadowland for hay. Pastures for grazing. Very few animals.Beef cattle. Few milking cows. Shire mare with two foals.Sheep.Horses for riding and hunting.The area is more wooded than in most parts of Essex.The soil is mainly boulder clay with chalk underlay and flints.Many small houses and walls reflect the latter. Early summer in May the rape bursts into bloom and the fields are great swathes of bright yellow.After the harvest the stubble is burnt off or ploughed in, leaving the fields a pattern of black and brown.After a few weeks winter wheat is planted and small green shoots soon appear.Spring and the fields are bright green.Summer; golden corn is ready for harvest again.
